active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the following scenario: A company experiences a data breach affecting 500 EU customers' emails but no sensitive data. Is Article 33 notification required? Why or why not? Consider risk to rights and freedoms, and compare to a similar US SEC materiality threshold. Support with GDPR Article 33 evidence.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in GDPR under Privacy and Data Protection Regulations. Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Legal, Regulatory, and Compliance > Privacy and Data Protection Regulations > General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) > Supervisory Authority Reporting. Focus strictly on GDPR Articles 33-34 for personal data breach notifications to supervisory authorities (72-hour timeline, content requirements); contextualize NIST/SEC as supplementary integrations only. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT FULL LIST FROM ABOVE] - Active Learning: [INSERT FULL DETAILS FROM ABOVE] - Scaffolding: [INSERT FULL 4 LAYERS FROM ABOVE] Generate 25 high-quality flashcards following this exact schema: [INSERT FULL FLASHCARD_SCHEMA FROM ABOVE] Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each as: {"front": "Question...", "back": {"correct_answer": "...", "explanation": "...", "source": "...", "active_learning_tie": "...", "bloom_level": "REMEMBER"}, "scaffolding_layer": 1}. Ensure accuracy from GDPR (eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg/2016/679/oj), real-world examples (CNIL, ICO). No US-centric primacy.
